citations.narrative:
The facility has obtained two artic foxes since their last inspection. Their enclosure is next to other enclosures containing
regulated animals, all of which are on exhibit.
Licenses authorize a specific number and specific type(s) of animals for use in regulated activity (i.e., exhibiting). A USDA
license must specifically authorize the use of exotic and wild canids, which include foxes.
The licensee must either remove these animals from exhibition permanently or must obtain a new license which
authorizes the use of this category of animal before continuing to exhibit these animals.
Correct by September 16, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.1(b)(2)(ii) 
   
Requirements and application 
The facility has obtained two artic foxes since their last inspection. Their enclosure is next to other enclosures containing 
regulated animals, all of which are on exhibit. 
 
Licenses authorize a specific number and specific type(s) of animals for use in regulated activity (i.e., exhibiting). A USDA 
license must specifically authorize the use of exotic and wild canids, which include foxes. 
 
The licensee must either remove these animals from exhibition permanently or must obtain a new license which 
authorizes the use of this category of animal before continuing to exhibit these animals. 
 
Correct by September 16, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
